definition: directly/head-on (collision)/in one's face (of wind)
to welcome/to meet/to face/to forge ahead (esp. in the face of difficulties)
face/side/surface/aspect/top/classifier for flat surfaces such as drums, mirrors, flags etc
and/as well as/and so/but (not)/yet (not)/(indicates causal relation)/(indicates change of state)/(indicates contrast)
to come/to arrive/to come round/ever since/next

sentences.english: Or is it the head light of an oncoming Umno train ?
sentences.chinese: 或者是它的頭部輕巫統一個迎面而來的火車？

sentences.english: 27When Jesus stepped ashore, he was met by a demon-possessed man from the town.
sentences.chinese: 耶穌上了岸，就有城裏一個被鬼附着的人迎面而來。

sentences.english: Entering from the sixth gate, the first building can be seen is the Chinese Pavilion.
sentences.chinese: 從六號門進入世博軸，迎面而來就是中國館。

sentences.english: Can fair lift Lian son, right opposition the face and lightly a pushed a person to return to.
sentences.chinese: 可剛掀簾子，迎面而來的輕輕一把就將人推了回去。

sentences.english: He walks towards an imminent, self-given death?
sentences.chinese: 他正走向迎面而來的咎由自取的死亡嗎？

sentences.english: Coming towards them are three young women.
sentences.chinese: 迎面而來的是三個年輕女子。

sentences.english: Down the tunnel, growing large, was the light of an oncoming subway.
sentences.chinese: 沿着隧道往下逐漸變大，迎面而來的是一個地鐵站臺。

definition: fast as lightning
to speed along
to waft (through the air)/to drift
lit. heart untroubled, spirit pleased (idiom); carefree and relaxed
a downpour/rain bucketing down/fig. to be overwhelmed (with work or things to study)
to pervade/to fill the air/diffuse/everywhere present/about to inundate (water)/permeated by (smoke)/filled with (dust)/to saturate (the air with fog, smoke etc)
sea breeze/sea wind (i.e. from the sea)
to drift
ear-splitting (idiom); deafening
to be adjusted to uniformity (usually of weights and measures) (idiom)
reluctant to part
to whistle/to scream/to whiz
suddenly/sudden
to lose one's head out of fear (idiom)
to bare fangs and brandish claws (idiom); to make threatening gestures
to cry out in fear
